Reviews.Title: “Travelzoo Deal”
Reviews.Author: Floweressence
Reviews.Content: Cannot complain at the price offered through Travel Zoo. We arrived to discover an enormous generator running full throttle outside. Unfortunately the hotel had received a power cut a few days prior which had yet to be fixed. Our room was on the top floor above the generator, so not much sleep for us, after walking all over Boston that day. An older hotel with charm and friendly staff, and an overpowering smell of cleaning fragrance in the entry foyer. Our bed was very firm to sleep on along with the pillows. No give or take there. We overslept, so ate breakfast around the corner at Dunkin' Donuts.

Reviews.Title: “Grim”
Reviews.Author: Citizen_of_Amherst
Reviews.Content: The lobby and the facade of this hotel don't look bad at all, but our room was grim. It reminded me of the dorm room at my under-funded state university. Yet at least the sheets on the bed in my dorm room actually fit and the comforter or duvet was not designed for a much smaller bed. For that matter, the dorm room's heat source did not blow hot air on my head as I slept. The heater in my room at this hotel was right by the bed. I wouldn't say that my hotel room was dirty, but the furniture was cheap and old, and the bathroom was shabby. I just love stepping into a shower and placing my feet on some grungy non-slip matting. The shower curtain rings were too small for the rod, so I couldn't actually close the curtain. The depressing yellow walls throughout the room were banged up as well. I like old hotels. I get that the rooms might be small and the bathrooms quirky. I've stayed at the Boston Park Plaza Hotel, which is also an older hotel. Yet my room at the Park Plaza was a palace compared to this depressing little hole. We couldn't wait to leave and noticed that no one at the front desk asked us if we had enjoyed our stay. Why ask a question when you already know the answer?

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, simple, inexpensive”
Reviews.Author: Craig F
Reviews.Content: I've been staying here for over 10 yrs, I also used to work here, ha! It doesn't look that much has changed, it needs some paint and new furniture and a tile scrub in the showers but you can't be the price. If you're not a princess, ha, I recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “could use upgrade but nice”
Reviews.Author: Maal1980
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for one night last saturday. Check in was a breeze and Claudette was very helpful. We parked right across the street and got a discount coupon for parking. Very close to train, mall and everything. The lobby and elevators look like they have been redone. Our room was clean but very outdated. We didnt mind as it was only for a night. There was free wifi and a breakfast in the morning BUT only served to 9:00AM even on the weekends.?? Didnt like that, but there was a one cup coffee pot in the room. They had bath & body works essentials in the bathroom and plenty of towels. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “You pay for location”
Reviews.Author: Christidis
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights, and chose it for its central location. We used the T to get there from the airport. Only 5 minute walk to Green Line! Dunkin Donuts around the corner. Breakfast was pretty decent: cereal, toast, bagels, pastries, muffins, tea, coffee, juice and fruit. The hotel itself is old though. They've tried updating furniture to make it newer. When we walked it, the lobby has an old musty smell. I consider these small incidentals though, because we wanted an affordable and clean room in the city center and thats what we got. Front desk staff were really nice. Complimentary internet access in the business center, with printing. We would stay again even though its not a top notch hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great old hotel right in the middle of Copely”
Reviews.Author: Joe M
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a night at this hotel this weekend for $69 , after getting a deal from Travel Zoo.com. We were pleasantly surprised at the room size , bigger than the room we stayed in on the previous night at the Omni Parker House. The Checkout time was noon and they let us store our bags for as long as wwe wanted while we walked around the city. Great place, the complimentry breakfast kept us going till lunch :-)

Reviews.Title: “Adequate Hotel...Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: tbajardi
Reviews.Content: We wer eheaded to Boston for a conference that was being held at the Westin. The special room rate was $309 a night!! Across the street is this little old historic hotel. We got a room with 2 full sized beds for $139/night!! We walked to the conference every day and saved almost $200/night!! It is not new but it is clean. It looks like the last renovation was in the 70's or so. The bathrooms are brown porcelain tile, TV's are tube TV's etc. The lobby is gorgeous and the breakfast/coffee in the morning was served on a nice sun room built out form the hotel. This hotel is right near the orange and green lines, a short walk to Roylston Street shopping and you can literally see Copley Square from the front door. Its an incredibly low price for its location and the beds were comfortable, the water was hot and the elevators worked. We were happy and had a lot more to spend while we were in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: HumanJukebox
Reviews.Content: On the Orange line metro which gives access to all areas of Boston very easily. We love Boston and its people we will be back! Don and Jean Geelong Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Hurry to get the biggest travel bargain EVAH!”
Reviews.Author: kmeagle
Reviews.Content: Stayed last night for a conference I was attending at Boston College. Got a phenomenal deal on Travelzoo. How can it be that for $69 you get to stay in a comfortable room in a really choice neighborhood? Yet it is so (through March, and if you book by Jan.15) Oh and you get a nice continental breakfast in the deal. The manager explained that there is a new owner who also owns the very ritzy Lenox Hotel. They are looking to cultivate a following with the Travelzoo deal and he says they have "big plans" for renovation.GREAT, I say! This property is now called the Boston Common Hotel. It is far from "common".

HotelInfo.Name: Boston Common Hotel and Conference Center
HotelInfo.Address: 40 Trinity Place, Boston, MA 02116 (Formerly John Hancock Hotel and Conference Center)
